column12: Description
Score this immediately after an enemy fighter is slain by a friendly fighter if the target was a **leader** or the target's Health characteristic was equal to or greater than the attacker's.

Score this immediately after you make an Attack roll that contained 3 or more dice if each result was a different symbol. If you are the **underdog**, the Attack roll can contain 2 or more dice instead.
Score this immediately after you make an Attack roll if all of the results were successes.
Score this immediately after you make an Attack roll if any of the results was a :atCrit:.
Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's Attack if the target was in enemy territory.
Score this immediately after an enemy fighter is slain if that fighter was the first fighter slain this combat phase.
Score this in an end phase if your warband Attacked 3 or more times this combat phase.
Score this in an end phase if 4 or more fighters are damaged and/or slain.
Score this in an end phase if 5 or more fighters have Move and/or Charge tokens.
Score this in an end phase if any enemy fighters are vulnerable.
Score this in an end phase if there are no enemy fighters in friendly territory.
Score this in an end phase if each enemy fighter is slain.

:surge: Play this immediately after you pick a weapon as part of an Attack. That weapon has +1 Attack dice for that Attack. If you are the **underdog**, that weapon has +2 Attack dice for that Attack instead.
:surge: Play this immediately after you pick a melee weapon as part of an Attack. That weapon has **Grievous** for that Attack.
Pick 1 friendly fighter that is within 2 hexes of another fighter. Push the other fighter 1 hex closer to that friendly fighter.
Pick a friendly fighter. Push that fighter 1 hex.
Push your **leader** up to 3 hexes. That push must end in a starting hex.
Pick a friendly fighter. Remove that fighter from the battlefield, and then place that fighter in an empty starting hex in friendly territory.
:surge: Play this immediately after you pick a fighter to Move. That fighter has +2 Move for that Move.
Pick a friendly fighter. Give that fighter a Guard token.
Pick a friendly fighter. Inflict 2 damage on that fighter and then remove 1 of that fighter's Move or Charge tokens.
Pick a friendly fighter. Heal that fighter. If you are the **underdog**, you can roll a Save dice. On a :dfBlock: or :dfCrit:, heal that fighter again.
This fighter cannot be Flanked or Surrounded.
Enemy fighters adjacent to this fighter are Flanked.
:surge: **Strike True:** After you make an Attack roll for this fighter, you can immediately re-roll 1 Attack dice in that Attack roll.
This fighter's melee weapons have **Grievous**.
This fighter's weapons have **Ensnare**.
This fighter's weapons have **Cleave**.
:surge: **Footwork:** Immediately after this fighter has Attacked, you can push this fighter 1 hex.
No more than 3 damage can be inflicted on this fighter in the same turn.
This fighter has +1 Health.
This fighter's melee weapons have +1 Attack dice.
Score this immediately after your opponent's Action step if a friendly fighter with any Charge tokens hold a treasure token in enemy territory.
Score this immediately after your opponent's Action step if a friendly fighter with any Stagger tokens holds a treasure token in enemy territory.

Score this immediately after your opponent's Action step if a friendly fighter with any Move tokens holds a treasure token in enemy territory. If you are the **underdog**, that friendly fighter can have any Charge tokens instead.
Score this immediately after an enemy fighter's Attack if a friendly fighter holding a treasure token was the target of that Attack.
Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's Attack if the attacker is holding a treasure token.
Score this immediately after a friendly fighter Moves if 2 or more friendly fighters that have Move tokens are in enemy territory.
Score this in an end phase if a friendly fighter holds treasure token 1 or 2.
Score this in an end phase if a friendly fighter holds treasure token 3 or 4.
Score this in an end phase if a friendly fighter holds treasure token 5.
Score this in an end phase if your warband holds any treasure tokens in both neutral territory and enemy territory.
Score this in an end phase if your warband holds all of the treasure tokens in a friendly and/or enemy territory.
Score this in an end phase if 2 or more friendly fighters with a total Bounty characteristic of 3 or more hold treasure tokens.
Pick 2 treasure tokens. Swap the positions of those treasure tokens.
Pick a friendly fighter. Push that fighter 1 hex.
:surge: Play this immediately after a friendly fighter Moves. Push that fighter 1 hex. That push must end on a feature token.
Pick a friendly fighter on a feature token. Give that fighter a Guard token.
Pick a friendly fighter. Heal that fighter. If you are the **underdog**, you can roll a Save dice. On a :dfBlock: or :dfCrit:, heal that fighter again.

Pick a friendly fighter in an edge hex. Remove that fighter from the battlefield, and then place that fighter in a different empty edge hex. Then, give that fighter a Move token, unless you are the **underdog**.
Pick 2 adjacent fighters. Remove those fighters from the battlefield and then place each in the hex the other was removed from.
Fighters cannot be driven back. This effect persists until the end of the next Action step.

:surge: Play this immediately after a friendly fighter's successful Attack if the target is adjacent. Remove the target from the battlefield, and then place them in a different empty hex adjacent to the attacker.
Draw a number of Power cards equal to the number of treasure tokens held by your warband.
If this fighter is the target of an Attack, the attacker cannot use Overrun.
This fighter cannot be Flanked or Surrounded while they hold a treasure token.
This fighter has +1 Move.
This fighter has +1 Save, to a maximum of 2.
This fighter cannot be driven back while they have any Charge tokens.
:surge: **Deft:** After you make a Save roll for this fighter, you can immediately re-roll 1 Save dice in that Save roll.
:surge: **Footwork:** Immediately after this fighter has Attacked, you can push this fighter 1 hex.
This fighter has +1 Health.
This fighter's melee weapons have +1 Attack dice.
This fighter's melee weapons have **Grievous**.

Score this in an end phase if 3 or more different treasure tokens were Delved by your warband this battle round or if a treasure token held by an enemy fighter at the start of the battle round was Delved by your warband this battle round.
Score this in an end phase if an odd-numbered treasure token was Delved by your warband this battle round.
Score this in an end phase if no friendly fighters are adjacent and any friendly fighters are not slain.
Score this in an end phase if there are 1 or fewer treasure tokens in friendly territory.
Score this in an end phase if there are 2 or fewer treasure tokens on the battlefield.
Score this in an end phase if there are no treasure tokens on the battlefield or if no enemy fighters hold any treasure tokens.

Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's successful Attack if the target was in neutral territory, or the target was holding a treasure token when you picked them to be the target of that Attack and is no longer holding that treasure token.
Score this immediately after a friendly fighter Delves in enemy territory. If you are the **underdog**, that Delve can be in friendly territory instead.
Score this immediately after your warband Delves for the third or subsequent time this combat phase.
Score this immediately after a friendly fighter Moves, if that fighter and any other friendly fighters are each on feature tokens.
Score this immediately after the second or subsequent Attack made by your warband that was not part of a Charge.
Score this immediately after an Action step if there is a friendly fighter in each territory.
Pick a friendly fighter. Push that fighter 1 hex.
:surge: Play this immediately after a friendly fighter's Attack if the attacker is in enemy territory. Heal the attacker.
Push your **leader** up to 3 hexes. That push must end in a starting hex.
Pick a treasure token that is not held. Flip that treasure token.
**Domain:** Friendly fighters have +1 Move while using Charge abilities. This effect persists until the end of the battle round or until another Domain card is played.
Pick a friendly fighter with any Charge tokens. Give that fighter a Guard token.

:surge: Play this immediately after you make an Attack roll for a fighter in enemy territory. Re-roll 1 dice in that Attack roll. If you are the **underdog**, you can re-roll each dice in that Attack roll instead.
Pick an enemy fighter adjacent to a friendly fighter. Give that enemy fighter a Stagger token.

Pick a friendly fighter with no Move or Charge tokens. Remove that fighter from the battlefield, and then place that fighter in an empty stagger hex. Then, give that fighter a Charge token. If you are the **underdog**, you can give that fighter a Move token instead.
Pick an undamaged enemy fighter within 1 hex of a treasure token. Inflict 1 damage ok that fighter.
This fighter have +1 Move.
:surge: **Quick:** Immediately after this fighter has Charged, you can push this fighter 1 hex.
**Melee Attack action** \n [:Hex: 2 - :atFury: 2 - :boom: 2] \n This weapon has +1 Attack dice while this fighter has any Stagger tokens or is on a feature token.
While this fighter is in enemy territory, Save rolls for this fighter cannot be affected by **Cleave** and **Ensnare**.

:surge: **Sneaky:** Immediately after you play a Ploy in a Power step, you can remove this fighter from the battlefield. Place this fighter in an empty stagger hex or in an empty starting hex in friendly territory, and then discard this card.
This fighter has +1 Save. \n Immediately discard this Upgrade after an enemy fighter's failed Attack if this fighter was the target.
This fighter's weapons have **Brutal**.
**Ranged Attack action** \n [:Hex: 3 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 1] \n This weapon has **Stagger** while this fighter is in enemy territory.
This fighter's melee weapons have **Grievous** if the target has a Health characteristic of 4 or more.

While this fighter is on a treasure token in enemy territory or is in a stagger hex, Save rolls for this fighter are not affected by **Cleave** and **Ensnare** and this fighter cannot be given Stagger tokens.
Score this in an end phase. Gain a number of Glory points equal to your Cataclysm value, to a maximum of 2.
Score this in an end phase if 2 or more enemy fighters are slain and/or damaged and any of those fighters were slain in the preceding combat phase.
Score this in an end phase if your warband holds 2 or more treasure tokens and holds all of the treasure tokens in any territories.
Score this in an end phase if the number of damaged and/or slain enemy fighters is greater than your Cataclysm value.
Score this in an end phase if your warband holds each odd-numbered treasure token.
Score this in an end phase if any friendly fighters are each equipped with 3 or more Upgrades.

Score this immediately after you advance your Cataclysm tracker 1 step as a result of a friendly fighter being slain. If you are the **underdog**, score this after you advance your Cataclysm tracker 1 step for any reason instead.
Score this immediately after your opponent's Power step if each friendly fighter is within 2 hexes of any enemy fighters.
Score this immediately after your opponent's Action step if your warband holds all of the treasure tokens in neutral territory.
Score this immediately after an Action step if all friendly fighters have Move and/or Charge tokens and there is a friendly fighter in each territory.
Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's successful melee Attack if no result in the target's Save roll was a success.
Score this immediately after a friendly fighter's successful melee Attack if the Attack roll contained 4 or more dice.
:surge: Play this immediately after you pick a weapon as part of an Attack. Rolls of :atSup2: count as successes for that Attack.

**Domain:** After each Action step, the player whose turn it is rolls a number of Attack dice equal to their Cataclysm value, or 1 Attack dice if they have no such value. \n If the roll contains any :atFury: or :atCrit:, their opponent must discard a Power card. This effect persists until the end of the battle round, until another Domain card is played, or until you advance your Cataclysm tracker.
Enemy fighters have -X Move in the next Action step, where X is your Cataclysm value.

Roll a number of Attack dice equal to your Cataclysm value. If the roll contains :atFury: or :atCrit:, pick a fighter. \n Inflict 1 damage on that fighter. If you picked a friendly fighter, you can inflict damage on that fighter up to your Cataclysm value instead.
Pick a stagger hex. Push each fighter within 1 hex of that stagger hex 1 hex.
Roll a number of Attack dice equal to your Cataclysm value for each fighter within 1 hex of neutral territory. \n If the roll contains any :atSmash: or :atCrit:, inflict 1 damage on that fighter.
Pick a number of enemy fighters up to your Cataclysm value. Give each of those fighters a Stagger token.

:surge: Play this immediately after a friendly fighter is picked to be the target of an Attack. Pick another friendly fighter. Push that fighter up to 3 hexes. That push must end adjacent to the attacker.

Pick a friendly fighter. Inspire that fighter. This effect persists for X Action steps where X is your Cataclysm value. After that effect ends, do not discard this card. Instead, Uninspire that fighter. That fighter cannot be Inspired again. This effect persists until the end of the game.

Pick a friendly fighter. That fighter immediately Attacks with the following weapon, where X is your Cataclysm value. 
 **Ranged Attack action** 
 [:Hex: 3 - :atSmash: X - :boom: 1] 
 This weapon cannot be modified.
**Tick Tock:** After this card is discarded during a Combat Phase, you can immediately advance your Cataclysm tracker 1 step.
This fighter has +X Move, where X is your cataclysm value. \n Immediately after this fighter Moves, give this fighter a Stagger token.
:surge: **Ever Closer:** Immediately advance your Cataclysm tracker 1 step after an enemy fighter is slain by this fighter. Then, if your Cataclysm value is 2 or greater, discard this card.
:surge: **Insensate:** Immediately after this fighter is driven back, you can heal this fighter.
This fighter's melee weapons have **Ensnare**.
This fighter's Save characteristic is X, where X is your Cataclysm value, and cannot be modified further.
:core: **Smoulder:** Pick a friendly fighter. Give that fighter a Stagger token. Then, draw 2 Power cards. If you are the **underdog**, draw 3 Power cards instead.
This fighter has +1 Health.
**Ranged Attack action** \n [:Hex: 3 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 1 -(:atCrit: **Cleave**)-]
**Melee Attack action** \n [:Hex: 1 - :atSmash: 2 - :boom: 3] \n Immediately after this fighter has Attacked with this weapon, inflict 1 damage on this fighter.
